title: Fix migration advisory lock to cover apply phase
description:
Problem
- AsyncMigrationManager.apply_pending_migrations() uses a session-level advisory lock but releases it before applying migrations.

Evidence
- Lock/unlock occurs inside the initial async with self.db.acquire() as conn: block, but the apply loop runs after the block ends and the connection is returned to the pool (src/pgdbm/migrations.py:407).

Impact
- Concurrent deploys/services can both see the same pending migrations and both apply them, leading to duplicate DDL/DML attempts, partial state, or confusing failures.

Suggested fix
- Keep a single connection for: acquire lock -> ensure migrations table -> read applied -> compute pending -> apply each migration + insert tracking row -> unlock -> release.
- Prefer using the existing _apply_migration_on(conn, migration) path (or refactor apply_migration() to accept an optional connection) so all writes are on the same session holding the lock.

Acceptance criteria
- Concurrent runs cannot interleave applies for the same module_name.
- A test demonstrates that a second runner blocks until the first releases the lock.
- Lock is held until all pending migrations are applied or an error occurs.
notes: Held advisory lock for full apply phase and apply migrations on same connection; added concurrency test. Tests: uv run pytest tests/integration/test_migrations.py::TestMigrationManagement::test_migration_lock_serializes_apply
